titles.title: Restoring Our Local Economies Act of 2010
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the benefits of empowerment zones and enterprise communities if those zones and communities are determined to still qualify for designation.
Restoring Our Local Economies Act of 2010

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

term.name: Urban and suburban affairs and development

bill.summary: Restoring Our Local Economies Act of 2010 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the designation of tax-preferred empowerment zones and enterprise communities, to allow a five-year extension of the designation period for a zone or community that is a qualifying zone. Defines "qualifying zone" as any designated empowerment zone or enterprise community if the government that nominated such zone or community requests an extension of the designation period and has submitted to the Secretary of the Treasury information indicating compliance with, and progress in achieving, certain benchmarks.
